featuredCaseStudy.title: LogiFlow: Strategic Growth Through Smart Funding

founder.name: Maria Rodriguez
founder.background: Former McKinsey consultant with 8 years in supply chain strategy. MBA from Wharton, specialized in operations research and logistics optimization.
founder.journey: Left consulting to solve supply chain inefficiencies she witnessed across Fortune 500 clients. Built LogiFlow to democratize enterprise-grade optimization tools for mid-market companies.

businessFeatures.title: AI-Powered Route Optimization
businessFeatures.description: Reduces delivery costs by 25-40% through machine learning algorithms that optimize routes in real-time, considering traffic, weather, and delivery windows.

businessFeatures.title: Inventory Prediction Engine
businessFeatures.description: Prevents stockouts and overstock situations using predictive analytics, saving clients an average of $2M annually in inventory carrying costs.

businessFeatures.title: Supplier Risk Assessment
businessFeatures.description: Real-time monitoring of supplier financial health and geopolitical risks, with automated alerts and alternative supplier recommendations.

featuredCaseStudy.fundingStory: After 23 rejections, Maria turned each "no" into market research. She refined her pitch deck 47 times, focusing on unit economics and customer retention metrics. Sequoia finally said yes when she demonstrated 140% net revenue retention and $4M ARR with only $500K initial investment.

investorSpotlight.name: Sarah Chen
investorSpotlight.description: Specializes in B2B SaaS and enterprise AI, with 15+ years backing category-defining companies like Salesforce and Zoom. Known for hands-on go-to-market strategy support.
investorSpotlight.quote: I look for founders who understand their unit economics cold and can articulate a clear path to $100M ARR. Maria's data-driven approach and deep domain expertise made LogiFlow an obvious investment.

businessMetrics.title: Supply Chain Tech Market Pulse
trends: Real-time visibility platforms in high demand

marketInsights.title: The Rise of Vertical SaaS in Supply Chain
marketInsights.content: Vertical SaaS solutions targeting specific supply chain niches are outperforming horizontal platforms by 3:1 in customer retention and 2.5:1 in revenue per customer.

featuredFounder.name: Alex Chen
featuredFounder.approach: Started with $5K savings, built MVP in 3 months, focused on solving a specific problem for small businesses. Bootstrapped to $10K MRR before seeking investment.
featuredFounder.result: Raised $2M seed round from Accel Partners, grew to $50K MRR within 6 months, now serving 200+ customers across 15 countries.
featuredFounder.lesson: Don't raise too early. Build something people actually want first, then use funding to accelerate what's already working.
